--- title: nimport keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: ""Nice Import": Calls `pip install` if `import` fails, then re-tries the import " description: ""Nice Import": Calls `pip install` if `import` fails, then re-tries the import " nb_path: "04_nimport.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

nimport[source]

nimport(import_str:str, consent:str='yes', verbosity:int=1, versions:str='')

Nice Import: Gracefully import, i.e. if import fails, install via pip & retry

args: import_str: A string form of the import statement you would otherwise execute

kwargs: consent: TODO: Let people say if they want to allow the install ['yes','no','ask'] verbosity: How much logging to print: 0=silent+errors, 1=installs, 2=everything versions: TODO: this would allow specific package versions to be specified

This supports these possible syntaxes for import_str:

from: 'from kora.selenium import wd' from-star: 'from fastai.vision.all import *' TODO: from-list and/or sub-sub-modules: 'from x.y.z import a, b, c' - unsupported for now as: 'import numpy as np' list: 'import bokeh, mrspuff as msp, torch' (include a 1-element list)

ISSUES: Some pip package names don't match their 'import' name. nimport won't handle that Example: BeautifulSoup: package is beautifulsoup4, import is bs4

This only pip-installs the named package, not any dependencies.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Tests

{% raw %} 
nimport('import numpy as np')          
assert str(np.array([1,2,3])) == '[1 2 3]'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'''Uninstall packages to make nimport work harder in what follows'''
!pip uninstall -y kora bokeh fastai auraloss torch

WARNING: Skipping kora as it is not installed.
Uninstalling bokeh-2.3.0:
  Successfully uninstalled bokeh-2.3.0
Uninstalling fastai-1.0.61:
  Successfully uninstalled fastai-1.0.61
WARNING: Skipping auraloss as it is not installed.
Uninstalling torch-1.8.1+cu101:
  Successfully uninstalled torch-1.8.1+cu101
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
nimport('from kora.selenium import wd')   
from types import ModuleType, FunctionType 
assert isinstance(wd, ModuleType)

  Import kora.selenium failed. Trying to install kora via pip
     pip succeeded. re-importing kora.selenium as wd
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
nimport('import bokeh, torch')
assert isinstance(bokeh.license, FunctionType)
assert torch.cuda.is_available() in [True, False]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
nimport('import auraloss')                   # will fail if torch was not installed
assert isinstance(auraloss.freq, ModuleType)

    Import auraloss failed, trying to install via pip
     pip succeeded. re-importing auraloss as auraloss
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
nimport('from fastai.vision.all import *')   # will fail if torch was not installed
assert URLs.MDL == 'http://files.fast.ai/models/'   

  Import fastai.vision.all failed. Trying to install fastai via pip
     pip succeeded. re-importing fastai.vision.all as *
{% endraw %}
